item.title: Alice Estate Agency
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Alice is a broker associate and Realtor. She is dedicated in helping buyers and sellers throughout the city. She enjoys the local aspect of real estate, spending time discovering and sharing the city community with her clients, including parks, neighbourhoods, changing trends and resources like restaurants and music venues.
She has served as her building’s board president for the past two years. She is also active in the community as a volunteer and donor for Children’s Services. Her designations include Certified International Property Specialist and membership of the International Real Estate Federation. Clients are impressed by her tireless work, negotiation skills, and business sense. They appreciate her communication skills, knowledge and ability to help them meet their real estate goals.

  • No Smoking

  • Minimum age of primary renter: 18
  • 100% refund if canceled at least 30 days before arrival date. 50% refund if canceled at least 7 days before arrival date.

item.title: realhomes
item.dc:creator: fahid

item.title: realhomes
item.dc:creator: fahid

item.title: When buying a new home, what upgrades should we go for? What holds the most value? Do we upgrade the lot? Pick more square footage in the house? Add an extra bedroom?, etc.
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
A lot depends on why you are buying the house. Are you buying it mostly as a home or mostly as an investment? There is a difference.

For the most part, upgrades are high-profit items for builders. They aren’t designed to enhance the value of the house, but make you happier with the house you do buy.

If you are looking at your home as an investment, then you buy from the smaller to medium size in the tract and spend only a minimal amount on upgrades. If you are looking at your purchase as a home, then you select upgrades that will enhance your quality of living.

One rule of thumb is to always upgrade the carpet and padding.

item.title: I have to make a choice between an updated home in an older neighborhood or a newer home in a more modern neighborhood. The home in the older neighborhood has almost everything I want and is much larger, but which makes the most sense as an investment?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
If your goal is to buy a home for it’s resale value and the one you are thinking of buying in the older neighborhood is at the upper end of values for that neighborhood, then it may not be the wisest choice. If it is similar or lower in price to the others, then there should be no problem, because pricing should be considered in relation to the local neighborhood and not compared to homes in other neighborhoods (for the most part)

Plus, is it a neighborhood on the decline, or are others going to be fixing things up, too, so that it is a neighborhood that is improving? It could turn out to be a very good deal as long as you don’t “overpay” because of the recent improvements.

Remember that you also buy a home for it’s value to you as a “home,” and that is something else you should consider. Which neighborhood would you AND your family feel most comfortable in?

item.title: I have a family friend who is a Realtor. I like her and she is a help but she gives me one price to sell my home for and I think it is too low. So I called another agent who suggested a price more in line with my expectations. Who do I choose?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
You might want to consult a couple more Realtors on the market value of your home. Most of the estimates should be in the same ballpark.

It could be that your friend is being more honest with you about the value of your home and the other Realtor gave you a higher number because he already knew you expected it. This is called “Buying a Listing” and is the subject of an article on our web site.

Or it could simply be that your friend is a good friend, but not that great of a real estate agent.

Mixing business and friendships is always risky to the friendship. On the other hand, if your friend is truly competent and was providing wise advice, she may be offended if you ignore the advice and choose another agent.

item.title: Why should I use a real estate salesperson?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
A real estate salesperson is more than just a “sales person.” They act on your behalf as your agent, providing you with advice and guidance and doing a job – helping you buy or sell a home. While it is true they get paid for what they do, so do other professions that provide advice, guidance, and have a service to sell –such as Certified Public Accountants and Attorneys

The Internet has opened up a world of information that wasn’t previously available to homebuyers and seller. The data on listings available for sale is almost current – but not quite. There are times when you need the most current information about what has sold or is for sale, and the only way to get that is with an agent.

If you’re selling a home, you gain access to the most buyers by being listed in the Multiple Listing Service. Only a licensed real estate agent who is a member of your local MLS can get you listed there – which then gets you automatically listed on some of the major real estate web sites. If you’re buying or selling a home, the MLS is your agent’s best tool.

However, the role of an agent has changed in the last couple of years. In the past, agents were the only way home buyers and sellers could access information. Now agents are evolving. Because today’s home buyers and sellers are so much better informed than in the past, expertise and ability are becoming more important.

The real estate agent is becoming more of a “guide” than a “salesperson” — your personal representative in buying or selling a home.

item.title: What is the difference between a real estate agent and a real estate broker?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Most states require real estate sales professionals to be licensed by the state, so that they can control education and experience requirements and have a central authority to resolve consumer problems. The terminology used to identify real estate professionals varies a little from state to state. Brokers are generally required to have more education and experience than real estate salespersons or agents. The person you normally deal with is a real estate agent or salesperson. The salesperson is licensed by the state, but must work for a broker. All listings are placed in the broker’s name, not the salesperson’s. A broker can deal directly with home buyers and sellers, or can have a staff of salespersons or agents working for him or her.

item.title: 10 Steps To Follow When Renting an Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Renting an apartment is a significant decision that requires careful consideration and planning. Whether you're a first-time renter or have experience in the rental market, following a structured process can help you find the right apartment that suits your needs and budget. Here are ten steps to follow when renting an apartment:

  1. Set a Budget: Determine how much you can comfortably afford to spend on rent each month. Your budget should include not only rent but also utilities, groceries, transportation, and other living expenses.
  2. Create a Wish List: Make a list of your apartment preferences and must-haves. Consider factors like location, size, number of bedrooms, amenities, and proximity to work, schools, or public transportation.
  3. Research Neighborhoods: Research different neighborhoods to find the one that best matches your lifestyle and needs. Consider safety, access to amenities, schools, and the overall vibe of the area.
  4. Start Your Search: Begin your apartment search using various resources, including online listings, rental websites, real estate apps, and local classifieds. You can also work with a real estate agent for more personalized assistance.
  5. Schedule Viewings: Once you've identified potential apartments, schedule viewings to inspect them in person. Pay attention to the condition of the unit, maintenance, and any potential issues.
  6. Check for Safety and Security: Evaluate the safety and security features of the building or complex. Look for secure entrances, well-lit common areas, and the presence of smoke detectors and fire extinguishers.
  7. Review the Lease Agreement: Carefully read the lease agreement, which is a legally binding contract between you and the landlord. Pay attention to terms, such as rent, security deposit, lease duration, and any rules or restrictions.
  8. Ask Questions: Don't hesitate to ask the landlord or property manager questions about the apartment, the neighborhood, and the lease terms. Clarify any doubts you may have before signing the lease.
  9. Inspect the Apartment: Before moving in, conduct a thorough inspection of the apartment. Document any existing damages or issues and bring them to the landlord's attention. This will help protect your security deposit when you move out.
  10. Secure Renters Insurance: Consider purchasing renters insurance to protect your personal belongings in case of theft, damage, or accidents. It's a relatively affordable way to provide peace of mind.

Renting an apartment is a significant commitment, so it's essential to take your time, do your research, and make an informed decision. By following these ten steps, you can navigate the rental process with confidence, ensuring that you find an apartment that meets your needs and aligns with your budget.

item.title: 11 Things You’ll Want In Your Next Vacation Place
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Planning your next vacation is an exciting endeavor. The anticipation of exploring new places, experiencing different cultures, and making lasting memories is enough to fuel your wanderlust. However, a crucial aspect of planning your dream vacation is choosing the right vacation place. Your choice of accommodation can significantly impact your overall travel experience. While everyone's preferences are unique, there are certain amenities and features that most travelers seek for a memorable trip. In this article, we'll explore 11 things you'll want in your next vacation place to make it an unforgettable getaway.

  1. Location, Location, Location: The importance of location cannot be overstated. A great vacation place should be situated close to the attractions, activities, and sights you plan to explore. Whether it's a beachfront property, a cabin in the woods, or a city apartment, proximity to your points of interest is key.
  2. Comfortable Accommodations: Comfortable and well-maintained accommodations are a must. Look for clean, spacious, and well-appointed rooms or living spaces that allow you to relax and unwind after a day of exploration.
  3. Safety and Security: Safety is a top priority for any traveler. Ensure that your vacation place provides a secure environment. Look for features such as secure entrances, well-lit common areas, and the presence of smoke detectors and fire extinguishers.
  4. A View to Remember: There's something truly special about waking up to a breathtaking view. Whether it's a scenic landscape, a vibrant cityscape, or an ocean vista, a captivating view can enhance your vacation experience.
  5. Outdoor Spaces: If you love spending time outdoors, seek accommodations that offer inviting outdoor spaces. Consider options like private balconies, terraces, gardens, or patios where you can soak in the natural beauty and fresh air.
  6. A Fully Equipped Kitchen: Having access to a well-equipped kitchen can be a game-changer, especially for travelers who enjoy cooking or want to prepare meals for dietary reasons. It also allows you to save money on dining out.
  7. High-Quality Amenities: Look for accommodations that offer a range of amenities to enhance your stay. This may include swimming pools, fitness centers, spa facilities, game rooms, or on-site dining options.
  8. Tech and Connectivity: In today's digital age, access to high-speed internet, smart TVs, and other tech amenities can make your stay more comfortable. It's also essential for staying connected with loved ones or for remote work if necessary.
  9. Accessibility Features: If you or someone in your travel party has mobility challenges, prioritize vacation places with accessibility features such as ramps, elevators, and ADA-compliant accommodations.
  10. Pet-Friendly Options: For travelers with furry companions, pet-friendly accommodations are a must. Look for vacation places that welcome pets, offer pet amenities, and are located near pet-friendly parks or trails.
  11. Local Insights and Hospitality: A warm welcome and local insights can elevate your vacation experience. Choose accommodations where the hosts or staff are knowledgeable about the area, offering recommendations for hidden gems, local cuisine, and cultural experiences.

In conclusion, your choice of vacation place plays a significant role in shaping your travel memories. While the preferences of travelers vary, the 11 factors mentioned above can serve as valuable guidelines when selecting your next vacation spot. Whether you're seeking relaxation, adventure, cultural exploration, or a mix of it all, finding a vacation place that meets your needs and desires will contribute to an unforgettable getaway. So, as you plan your next adventure, consider these 11 essential elements to create the vacation of your dreams.

item.title: FAQs
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Frequently Asked Questions

[faqs style="accordion"]

Every stay has a story

Our stay at RealHomes was nothing short of extraordinary! The attention to detail in the luxurious accommodations, the impeccable service, and the stunning views made our vacation truly unforgettable. This hotel has set a new standard for excellence, and we can't wait to return.

Melisa Adam

America

I've never experienced such warm and personalized service as I did at RealHomes. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our every need was met. From the concierge's helpful recommendations to the housekeeping team's meticulous attention to detail.

Ricky Smith

France

Traveling with young children can be a challenge, but RealHomes made it a breeze. The family-friendly amenities, from the spacious rooms to the thoughtful kids' club activities, made our stay stress-free and enjoyable. We've found our go-to hotel for family vacations!

Leslie M Jay

America

As a food enthusiast, I was blown away by the culinary experience at RealHomes. Every meal was a masterpiece, and the diverse range of dining options ensured there was something for every palate. The chefs at this hotel are true artists, and I can't wait to savor their creations again.

David William

Germany

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Where hospitality meets your dreams

At RealHomes, we believe in the power of exceptional experiences. With a passion for hospitality, we strive to create moments that linger in your heart long after your stay.

Know More

100K+

Served Clients

120+

Staff Members

50+

Locations

428+

Available Rooms

Immerse yourself in our featured suites

Experience a stay like no other as you immerse yourself in our featured rooms, carefully crafted to provide the perfect blend of comfort and luxury.

Welcome to our Family Suite, where luxury meets comfort in a

Pamper yourself with an array of luxurious amenities designed to enhance your stay and create a truly indulgent experience.

Spa & Wellness

Open Daily

Breakfast & Dinner

Our exquisite room listings await

Experience unparalleled comfort and luxury at our hotel, where every room is designed to exceed your expectations. From spacious accommodations to top-notch amenities, we offer a retreat that promises relaxation and rejuvenation.

$215 / Per Night

Queen Room

Experience the epitome of refinement and comfort in our queen rooms. Designed with your utmost comfort in mind,

Welcome to our Deluxe Room, where luxury meets comfort in a perfect blend. As you step into this

Embrace the essence of tranquility and elegance in our single rooms. Designed for the discerning traveler seeking comfort

Hill Top View

Every stay has a story

Our stay at RealHomes was nothing short of extraordinary! The attention to detail in the luxurious accommodations, the impeccable service, and the stunning views made our vacation truly unforgettable. This hotel has set a new standard for excellence, and we can't wait to return.

Melisa Adam

America

I've never experienced such warm and personalized service as I did at RealHomes. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our every need was met. From the concierge's helpful recommendations to the housekeeping team's meticulous attention to detail.

Ricky Smith

France

Traveling with young children can be a challenge, but RealHomes made it a breeze. The family-friendly amenities, from the spacious rooms to the thoughtful kids' club activities, made our stay stress-free and enjoyable. We've found our go-to hotel for family vacations!

Leslie M Jay

America

As a food enthusiast, I was blown away by the culinary experience at RealHomes. Every meal was a masterpiece, and the diverse range of dining options ensured there was something for every palate. The chefs at this hotel are true artists, and I can't wait to savor their creations again.

David William

Germany

Indulge in Luxury for Less with Our Special Offers

Experience the lavish accommodations, impeccable service, and world-class amenities that our hotel has to offer, all at a fraction of the price. Treat yourself to a well-deserved escape without compromising on quality or comfort.

Previous Next

35% Off

Bulk Vacations Deal

40% Off

  • Closet airport 9.2 KM

  • City center 1.4 KM
  • Railway station 1.8 KM
  • Cinema 2.7 KM

item.title: 5 Factors Affecting the Rental Cost of in States
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
The cost of renting a property can vary significantly from one state to another in the United States. There are several factors that contribute to these differences, making it crucial for tenants and landlords to understand what influences rental prices in their respective states. In this article, we will explore five key factors that affect rental costs in states.

  1. Location and Demand: The old adage "location, location, location" holds true when it comes to rental costs. Urban areas with high demand for housing tend to have higher rental prices. States with major cities like New York, California, and Massachusetts often have expensive rental markets due to the concentration of jobs, amenities, and cultural attractions. Conversely, rural states with lower population density generally have more affordable rentals.
  2. Local Economy: The economic health of a state can significantly impact rental costs. States with robust economies, driven by industries such as technology, finance, or entertainment, tend to have higher average incomes and, subsequently, higher rental prices. States with weaker economies and fewer employment opportunities often offer more affordable rental options.
  3. Housing Supply: The availability of rental properties plays a crucial role in determining rental costs. States with limited housing supply and high demand can experience steep rental price increases. Conversely, states with a surplus of available rental units are likelier to have stable or lower rental costs. Factors such as zoning regulations and construction rates influence housing supply.
  4. Property Type and Size: The type and size of the rental property also affect rental costs. More significant, more luxurious properties, such as single-family homes and upscale apartments, typically command higher rents. Smaller units, such as studios or one-bedroom apartments, are often more affordable. In addition, amenities like swimming pools, fitness centers, and pet-friendly policies can influence rental prices.
  5. Local Legislation and Regulations: State and local laws and regulations can have a substantial impact on rental costs. Rent control policies, eviction laws, and tenant rights can differ significantly from state to state. Some states have stricter rent control measures that limit rent increases, while others have more landlord-friendly regulations that allow for greater flexibility in pricing. Understanding the legal framework is essential for both tenants and landlords.

In conclusion, the rental cost in states is influenced by a complex interplay of factors, including location, local economy, housing supply, property type, and legislative regulations. Tenants and landlords should carefully consider these factors when navigating the rental market. It's important to conduct thorough research and assess individual circumstances to make informed decisions about renting or investing in rental properties.

Moreover, prospective tenants should budget accordingly and prioritize their housing needs based on their financial capacity and lifestyle preferences. Landlords should keep abreast of market trends and adhere to legal requirements while setting rental prices. By understanding the factors affecting rental costs in their respective states, both tenants and landlords can make sound choices in the dynamic and ever-changing rental market landscape.

item.title: When you need to have a utilities-included apartments
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
"Utilities-included apartments" refer to rental units where the cost of utilities like water, electricity, gas, and sometimes even internet and cable TV is bundled into the rent. These types of apartments can be appealing for various reasons, and there are specific situations where they make sense. In this article, we'll explore when you might consider renting a utilities-included apartment.

  1. Budgeting Simplicity: One of the primary reasons people opt for utilities-included apartments is the simplicity it offers in budgeting. With all essential utilities rolled into a single monthly payment, tenants have a clear understanding of their total housing costs, making it easier to manage finances.
  2. Predictable Expenses: Utilities-included apartments provide predictable monthly expenses, which can be especially beneficial for those on fixed incomes or tight budgets. It eliminates the unpredictability of utility bills, which can vary significantly with changes in weather or usage.
  3. Short-Term Stays: If you're planning to stay in an area for a short period, such as a few months or a year, utilities-included apartments can be a convenient choice. You won't have to set up utility accounts, pay deposits, or deal with the hassle of disconnecting services when you leave.
  4. Furnished Rentals: Many furnished apartments come with utilities included as part of the package. These are popular among travelers, students, and professionals on temporary assignments who want a turnkey living solution.
  5. Avoiding Utility Setup Hassles: Moving into a new place often involves the hassle of setting up utility accounts, which may require time and paperwork. In utilities-included apartments, these tasks are handled by the landlord or property management.
  6. Savings on Administrative Fees: Some utility providers charge administrative fees for account setup, transfers, or disconnecting services. By opting for utilities-included apartments, you can avoid these additional costs.
  7. Energy Efficiency: In some cases, landlords of utilities-included apartments invest in energy-efficient appliances and improvements, which can lead to lower overall utility costs. This is particularly appealing for eco-conscious renters.
  8. Shared Housing Arrangements: In shared housing situations, where multiple tenants are responsible for the rent and utilities, having utilities included can simplify the division of expenses and reduce conflicts over usage.
  9. All-Inclusive Resorts or Housing Communities: Vacationers and retirees often choose all-inclusive resorts or housing communities where utilities, as well as amenities like maintenance and security, are bundled into the overall cost.
  10. Extreme Weather Conditions: In regions with extreme weather conditions, such as harsh winters or scorching summers, utilities-included apartments can provide peace of mind, as tenants won't have to worry about skyrocketing heating or cooling bills.

It's important to note that while utilities-included apartments offer convenience, they may come at a slightly higher monthly rent compared to units where utilities are paid separately. Additionally, it's essential to review the terms of the lease carefully to understand what utilities are included and any usage limitations.

Ultimately, the decision to rent a utilities-included apartment depends on your specific circumstances, budget, and priorities. If the convenience and predictability of bundled utilities align with your needs and preferences, such an apartment can be an excellent choice for hassle-free living.

item.title: Things to consider in a rental place when traveling with kids
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Traveling with children can be an exciting adventure, but it also comes with unique challenges and considerations, especially when it comes to finding the right rental place. Parents want their kids to feel comfortable and safe while away from home. In this article, we'll explore essential factors to consider when choosing a rental place for a family vacation with children.

  1. Location Proximity to Attractions: Opt for a rental place that is conveniently located near family-friendly attractions and activities. This minimizes travel time and reduces the chances of children getting restless during long commutes. Research the local area to ensure there are parks, playgrounds, and entertainment options nearby.
  2. Safety and Childproofing: Safety should be a top priority. Check if the rental property is childproofed, with measures like cabinet locks, outlet covers, and stair gates. If not, consider bringing portable childproofing supplies. Also, assess the property for potential hazards such as sharp corners or exposed wiring.
  3. Space and Layout: Evaluate the layout and size of the rental place. Families with kids often benefit from multiple bedrooms or a separate living area where children can play. An open floor plan allows for better supervision. Check if there's outdoor space where kids can run and play safely.
  4. Amenities for Kids: Look for accommodations that offer kid-friendly amenities, such as cribs, high chairs, and baby bathtubs. Some rentals may also provide toys, books, or games for children. Having these amenities on-site can lighten the packing load for parents.
  5. Kitchen Facilities: Consider rentals with well-equipped kitchens. This allows you to prepare meals for picky eaters and accommodate dietary restrictions more easily. Having access to a refrigerator, microwave, and stove can be a game-changer for family dining.
  6. Laundry Facilities: Traveling with kids often means frequent wardrobe changes. A rental with laundry facilities or access to a washer and dryer can be a lifesaver. It reduces the need to pack excessive clothing and keeps everyone looking fresh.
  7. Reviews and Recommendations: Before booking, read reviews from other families who have stayed at the rental property. Their experiences can provide valuable insights into how child-friendly the place is and whether it meets your needs.
  8. Safety Features: Inspect the property for safety features like pool gates, balcony railings, and secure window locks. Ensure that any potential hazards are well addressed. If the property has a pool, inquire about pool safety measures.
  9. Local Healthcare Facilities: Research the availability of medical facilities, such as hospitals and pediatric clinics, in the area. Knowing where to go in case of a medical emergency provides peace of mind.
  10. Emergency Contact Information: Have emergency contact information readily available, including local emergency services, as well as contacts provided by the rental host or management.
  11. Child-Friendly Neighborhood: Consider the neighborhood's overall friendliness to families. Are there sidewalks for stroller walks, family-friendly restaurants, and a welcoming atmosphere for children?
  12. Budgetary Considerations: While ensuring a comfortable stay is crucial, it's also important to stay within budget. Look for rental options that strike a balance between your family's needs and your financial constraints.

Remember that every family is unique, and what works for one may not work for another. Tailor your rental selection to match your specific needs and preferences when traveling with kids. A well-chosen rental place can enhance the overall travel experience, making it enjoyable and memorable for both parents and children alike.

item.title: Twin Room
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Discover the perfect harmony of comfort and convenience in our twin rooms. Ideal for friends, family, or colleagues traveling together, our twin rooms offer spacious accommodations designed to ensure a restful stay for all guests. Each room is thoughtfully appointed with modern amenities and cozy furnishings, providing a welcoming retreat after a day of exploration or business meetings. With ample space and comfortable bedding, our twin rooms offer the ideal setting for bonding moments and shared experiences. Experience true hospitality and relaxation in our twin rooms - your home away from home for memorable stays.

item.title: Deluxe Room
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our Deluxe Room, where luxury meets comfort in a perfect blend. As you step into this spacious haven, you'll be greeted by a tastefully designed interior that exudes elegance and sophistication. The room features a king-sized bed with premium linens, ensuring a restful night's sleep. Plush pillows and a cozy duvet invite you to sink into pure relaxation. The décor is thoughtfully curated, combining modern aesthetics with timeless charm, creating an atmosphere that feels both opulent and inviting.

item.title: Queen Room
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Experience the epitome of refinement and comfort in our queen rooms. Designed with your utmost comfort in mind, these spacious accommodations offer a perfect blend of style and functionality. Sink into plush bedding after a day of adventures, and wake up refreshed and rejuvenated for whatever the day holds. With thoughtful amenities and elegant touches throughout, our queen rooms provide a sanctuary where you can relax and recharge in style. Discover true relaxation and sophistication in our queen rooms - your ideal haven away from home.

item.title: Deluxe Suite
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our Deluxe Suite, where luxury meets comfort in a perfect blend. As you step into this spacious haven, you'll be greeted by a tastefully designed interior that exudes elegance and sophistication. The room features a king-sized bed with premium linens, ensuring a restful night's sleep. Plush pillows and a cozy duvet invite you to sink into pure relaxation. The décor is thoughtfully curated, combining modern aesthetics with timeless charm, creating an atmosphere that feels both opulent and inviting.
